abstract: A lawsuit brought by participants in Ameriprise's 401(k) plan raises questions about how it treats its customers' money.
snippet: A lawsuit brought by participants in Ameriprise's 401(k) plan raises questions about how it treats its customers' money.
lead_paragraph: My column this week is about Ameriprise, a company rich with history, though not always the good kind. It deserves a ton of credit for making financial planning central to its work with customers, but it has also run into plenty of trouble with regulators over the years.

headline.main: Ameriprise and the Meaning of Its 401(k) Lawsuit
